All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
ActivePlayerState
Player is active
AdjacencyScoreCalculation
A class that contains the static methods used to calculate the points gained from the adjacency of tiles in the shelf
Bag
A class that represents the object that contains the ItemTiles that still has not been placed on the board
Board
The class that represents the board where the ItemTiles are placed and can be picked up from
BoardController
The BoardController class is responsible for managing the GUI scene of the game board.
BoardMemory
this class is used to access a specific child of the board.
BoardMTC
This class represents a message to the client containing the current state of the game board.
BoardObserver
The BoardObserver class is responsible for observing changes in the BoardRepresentation class and updating the board in the GUI.
BoardRefresher
This class contains the method called when the board needs to be refilled
BoardRepresentation
Virtual model representation of the board
BoardView
Provides the necessary tools to print a drawing of the game's board
BoardVV
This class is a model observer that listens for changes in the game board and sends an updated board to the clients.
ByeExecutor
This class is responsible for executing the ByeMTS command received from the client.
ByeMTS
Removes a player permanently from the game
CanIPlayExecutor
This class is responsible for executing the CanIPlayMTS command received from the client.
CanIPlayMTS
Asks to join a game
CardImagesManager
The CardImagesManager class is responsible for managing and providing access to images of objective cards.
ChatCE
Lets the player send a public chat message
ChatController
This class is responsible for managing the chat functionality in the GUI.
ChatExecutor
This class is responsible for executing the ChatMTS command received from the client.
ChatMemory
The ChatMemory class is used to manage the messages in the chat.
ChatMTC
This class represents a message to the client containing a chat message.
ChatMTS
Posts a message to the public chat
ChatObserver
The ChatObserver class is responsible for observing changes in the ChatRepresentation class and updating the chat in the GUI.
ChatRepresentation
Virtual model representation of the game chat
ChatView
Provides the necessary tools to print a drawing of the game's chat
ChosenTilesTable
The class that contains the ItemTiles that have been chosen to be picked up from the board
ChosenTilesTableMTC
This class represents a message to the client containing the current chosen tiles on the table.
ChosenTilesTableVV
This class is a model observer that listens for changes in the chosen tiles table and sends an updated table to the clients.
Client
Abstract class to communicate with the server.
ClientApp
Main of the client app.
ClientHandler
Abstract class that handle clients.
Color
 
ColorsCE
Lets the user decide whether to use colors or not
CommandExecutor
 
CommandExecutorFactory
Selects which command corresponds to the player's input
CommonCardDealer
A class with static methods that manage the random choice of the common goal cards of the game
CommonGoalCard
The class that represents a common goal card
CommonGoalCE
Prints the game's common goal cards with a description on what to do to complete them
CommonGoalMTC
This class represents a message to the client containing the information about the common goal cards.
CommonGoalReader
Reads common goal data from json files
CommonGoalsObserver
The CommonGoalsObserver class is responsible for observing changes in the CommonGoalsRepresentation class and updating the common goals in the GUI.
CommonGoalsRepresentation
Virtual model representation of the game's common goals
CommonGoalStrategy
a class that represent a particular kind of common goal card Strategy.
CommonGoalView
Provides the necessary tools to print a drawing of the game's common goal cards
CommonGoalVV
The CommonGoalVV class is a model observer that listens for changes in the common goals and sends an updated common goals list to the clients.
ConnectionPendingTimer
The ConnectionPendingTimer class is used to measure the time taken by the server to respond.
ConnectionRestoredExecutor
This class class is responsible for executing the restoration of a player's connection in the game.
DisconnectCE
Disconnects the player from the game (this will result in the program terminating)
DisconnectionErrorSceneController
This class is responsible for controlling the disconnection error scene in the GUI.
EchoID
 
EchoMTC
The EchoMTC class represents a message to the client containing an echo message of type EchoID id.
EchoObserver
The EchoObserver class is responsible for observing changes in the EchosRepresentation class and updating the echo messages in the GUI.
EchosRepresentation
 
EightTilesSameColorCGS
Rule: Eight tiles of the same type.
EndOfTurnObserver
The interface representing an observer that manages the actions that needs to happen at the end of every player turn
EndOfTurnSubject
The interface of the subject observed by an EndOfTurnObserver
EnterGameSceneController
This class class is responsible for controlling the enter game scene in the GUI.
Executor
 
FiveTilesDiagonalCGS
Rule: Five tiles of the same type forming a diagonal.
FourAnglesCGS
Rule: Four tiles of the same type in the four corners of the bookshelf.
FourGroupsOfFourCGS
Rule: Four groups each containing at least 4 tiles of the same type The tiles of one group can be different from those of another group.
FourRowsOfFiveCGS
Rule: Four lines each formed by 5 tiles of maximum three different types.
Game
A class that represent a single Game It contains and manages the classes of the model and their observers
GameMTC
This class represents a message to the client containing information about the game state.
GameObserver
The GameObserver class is responsible for observing changes in the GameRepresentation class and updating the game state in the GUI.
GameRepresentation
Virtual model representation of the game
GamesManager
Singleton class that contains the games that are being played
GameStartupState
Waits for game data to load
GameState
 
GameStopper
A class that prints and handles the endgame procedure, telling the players if they won or not and closing the game
GameVV
This class is a model observer that listens for changes in the game state and sends an updated game state to the clients.
Gui
A class that starts a javafx application with graphical interface
GuiController
The GuiController class is an abstract class that serves as the base class for all GUI scene controllers.
HandshakeExecutor
This class is responsible for executing the handshake process when a client connects to the server and receives a HandshakeMTS.
HandshakeMTS
Connects the client for the first time
InputReader
This class is used to read the input stream and making the input kind of interruptible.
InputState
 
InputValidator
 
InsertTileMTS
Asks to insert a tile in the sender's shelf
InsertTilesCE
Allows the user to insert tiles into his shelf
InsertTilesExecutor
This class is responsible for executing the InsertTileMTS command received from the client.
InvalidCE
Tells the user an input in invalid
ItemRefillUtility
The ItemRefillUtility class provides utility methods for managing item tiles in the GUI.
ItemTile
A class representing a tile
ItemTileMemory
The ItemTileMemory class is responsible for storing and retrieving information related to item tiles in the GUI.
JSONFileReader
 
LobbyController
this class is responsible for controlling the lobby scene in the GUI.
LoginSceneController
The LoginSceneController class is responsible for controlling the login scene in the GUI.
LookUpTableReader
Reads look up tables data from json files
MessageToClient
the classes that will be sent using the socket must implement this interface
MessageToServer
 
ModelObserver
 
ModelSubject
 
NewGameExecutor
This class is responsible for executing the NewGameMTS command received from the client.
NewGameMTS
Creates a new game
NicknameState
Asks the player for a nickname and sends it to the server
ObjectiveCardController
This class is responsible for controlling the objective card scene in the GUI.
OtherShelvesController
The OtherShelvesController class is responsible for controlling the scene displaying the shelves of other players in the GUI.
PChatCE
Lets the player send a private chat message
PersonalCardDealer
This class is used to draw a number of PersonalGoal cards from the deck and assign each card to a different player
PersonalGoal
A class describing the personal goals a certain player has to complete to earn points, it contains a map containing where the player needs to put a tile of a certain color to earn points
PersonalGoalCE
Prints the player's personal goal card and a brief description
PersonalGoalReader
Reads personal goal cards data from json files
PersonalGoalView
Provides the necessary tools to print a drawing of the player's personal goal card
PickupTilesCE
Allows the user to pick up tiles from the board
PickupTilesExecutor
This class is responsible for executing the PickUpTilesMTS command received from the client.
PickUpTilesMTS
Asks to pick up a list of tiles from the board
PickUpValidator
The class that contains the static methods to check whether the ItemTiles selected by the player can be picked up from the board
PingController
This class is responsible for managing the ping-pong communication between the server and a client.
PingMTC
This class represents a message to the client indicating a ping request.
PingRoutine
sends a ping message to the client
Player
A class that represents a player in the game.
PlayerMTC
This class represents a message to the client containing information about a player in the game.
PlayerNumSceneController
This class is responsible for controlling the player number selection scene in the GUI.
PlayerObserver
The PlayerObserver class is responsible for observing changes in the PlayersRepresentation class and updating the players in the GUI.
PlayersRepresentation
Virtual model representation of the players
PlayerVV
The PlayerVV class is a model observer that listens for changes in the player state and sends an updated player state to the clients.
PongExecutor
The PongExecutor class is responsible for executing the PongMTS command received from the client.
PongMTS
Response to PingMTC
Printer
Prints virtual model data
Reader
Reads user input
RefreshCE
Prints and updated game home screen
RefreshTrigger
This class contains helper methods used by the BoardRefresher class
ScaleCGS
Rule: Five columns of increasing or decreasing height.
ScoreBoard
The purpose of this class is to calculate the scores and assign points to the players whenever they complete either a personal or common goal, fill their shelf before the others or place tiles of the same colors adjacently in the shelf, it is called at the end of each turn to check if a player can earn any points
Server
Server class used to log messages.
ServerApp
Main of the server app.
ServerSocketAccepter
Socket server that handles all the new socket connection.
Shelf
A class representing the player's shelf.
ShelfMemory
The ShelfMemory class is responsible for storing and retrieving information related to the player's shelf in the GUI.
ShelfMTC
This class represents a message to the client containing information about a player's shelf in the game.
ShelfObserver
The ShelfObserver class is responsible for observing changes in the ShelvesRepresentation class and updating the shelf in the GUI.
ShelfUtils
A class that contains helper methods used by CommonGoalStrategy classes
ShelfView
Provides the necessary tools to print a drawing of the shelves
ShelfVV
The ShelfVV class is a model observer that listens for changes in the player's shelf and sends an updated shelf state to the clients.
ShelvesCE
Shows the user a player's shelf
ShelvesRepresentation
Virtual model representation of the shelves
SixGroupsOfTwoCGS
Rule: Six groups each containing at least 2 tiles of the same type.
SocketClient
Singleton class owned by each client, handles the socket that communicates through the network
SocketClientHandler
One instance for each client in a Thread, useful to direct traffic
StageController
This class represents the current stage used to play the game.
StartOrJoinState
Asks the player whether to start a new game or join an existing one
ThreeMaxThreeDiffCGS
Rule: Three columns each formed by 6 tiles of maximum three different types.
TilesTableObserver
The TilesTableObserver class is responsible for observing changes in the TilesTableRepresentation class and updating the chosen tiles table in the GUI.
TilesTableRepresentation
Virtual model representation of the picked up tiles
TilesTableView
Provides the necessary tools to print a drawing of the tiles that are to be inserted
TurnHandler
A class representing the turn handler of the game.
TwoColSixDiffCGS
Rule: Two columns each formed by 6 different types of tiles.
TwoRowsWithFiveDiffCGS
Rule: Two lines each formed by 5 different types of tiles.
TwoSquaresCGS
Rule: Two groups each containing 4 tiles of the same type in a 2x2 square.
ViewElement
 
VirtualModelObserver
 
VirtualModelSubject
 
VirtualView
This class represents the virtual view of the game.
WaitingForPlayersState
Player is waiting for other players to join and for the game to start
WaitingPlayerState
Player is not active
WaitingRoomController
This class is responsible for controlling the waiting room scene in the GUI.
WinSceneController
This class is responsible for controlling the win scene in the GUI.
XShapedCGS
Rule: Five tiles of the same type forming an X.
